concepts.name: Types of angles (acute, right, obtuse, straight, reflex, complete)
Adjacent angles and linear pair of angles
Angles on a line and angles at a point
Perpendicular lines and parallel lines with transversal

questions.question_text: An angle measuring 45° is called:
questions.explanation_correct: An angle measuring 45° is called an acute angle because it is less than 90 degrees. Acute angles are angles that are smaller than a right angle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is A) Acute angle. An angle measuring 45 degrees is an acute angle, which is an angle that is less than 90 degrees. B) Right angle is an angle of exactly 90 degrees, C) Obtuse angle is an angle greater than 90 degrees, and D) Straight angle is an angle of exactly 180 degrees.

questions.question_text: A reflex angle is greater than 180° but less than 360°.
questions.explanation_correct: A reflex angle is an angle that is greater than 180° but less than 360°. This means it is more than a straight angle (180°) but less than a full circle (360°).
questions.explanation_incorrect: A common misconception is that a reflex angle is any angle greater than 90°. However, a reflex angle is specifically an angle that is greater than 180° but less than 360°. An angle that is greater than 90° but less than 180° is called an obtuse angle, not a reflex angle.

questions.question_text: An angle measuring exactly 180° is called a ________ angle.
questions.explanation_correct: An angle measuring exactly 180° is called a straight angle because it forms a straight line, dividing the space into two equal halves.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The angle you are describing is not a right angle, which measures 90°. It is also not an acute angle, which measures less than 90°, or an obtuse angle, which measures more than 90°. The correct name for an angle that measures exactly 180° is a straight angle.

questions.question_text: Which of the following angles is an obtuse angle?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is C) 125°. An obtuse angle is any angle greater than 90°, and 125° is an obtuse angle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The answer is not A) 89°, B) 90°, or D) 200°. These are not obtuse angles. An obtuse angle is greater than 90°, and 125° in option C) is the only obtuse angle in the given options.

questions.question_text: A complete angle measures ________ degrees.
questions.explanation_correct: A complete angle measures 360 degrees because a circle has 360 degrees. This means that if you divide a full circle into 360 equal parts, each part is 1 degree. Therefore, the total measure of a complete angle is 360 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The answer is not 180 degrees. A complete angle, which is a full circle, measures 360 degrees. This is because a circle is divided into 360 equal parts, and each part is 1 degree. So, the total measure of a complete angle, which is a full circle, is 360 degrees.

questions.question_text: If an angle is 3 times its complement, what type of angle is it?
questions.explanation_correct: An angle that is 3 times its complement is an acute angle. This is because the complement of an angle is 90 degrees minus the angle. If the angle is 3 times its complement, it means the angle is less than 45 degrees, which is an acute angle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The angle is not a right angle, obtuse angle, or straight angle. A right angle is 90 degrees, an obtuse angle is greater than 90 degrees, and a straight angle is 180 degrees. Since the angle is 3 times its complement, it must be an acute angle that is less than 45 degrees.

questions.question_text: Two angles are complementary if their sum is:
questions.explanation_correct: Two angles are complementary if their sum is 90°. This means the two angles together make a right angle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The sum of two complementary angles is not 180°, 270°, or 360°. Those sums would be for other types of angle relationships, such as supplementary angles or full rotations. The correct answer is A) 90°, because complementary angles add up to a right angle.

questions.question_text: The complement of 35° is ________ degrees.
questions.explanation_correct: The complement of an angle is the angle that, when added to the original angle, gives 90 degrees. Since 35 degrees + 55 degrees = 90 degrees, the complement of 35 degrees is 55 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answer would be 45 degrees. However, the complement of 35 degrees is 55 degrees, because when you add 35 degrees and 55 degrees, the total is 90 degrees. The correct answer to fill in the blank is 55 degrees.

questions.question_text: Two angles measuring 110° and 70° are supplementary angles.
questions.explanation_correct: Two angles are supplementary if their sum is 180°. In this case, the two angles measuring 110° and 70° add up to 180°, so they are supplementary angles.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement is true because supplementary angles are two angles that add up to 180°. Even though 110° and 70° are not equal, their sum is 180°, which means they are supplementary angles.

questions.question_text: The supplement of 125° is:
questions.explanation_correct: The supplement of 125° is 55°. The supplement of an angle is the angle that, when added to the original angle, equals 180°. So the supplement of 125° is 180° - 125° = 55°.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The supplement of an angle is the angle that, when added to the original angle, equals 180°. Option A (35°) and Option D (65°) are not the supplement of 125°, as they do not add up to 180°. Option B (45°) is also not the supplement, as 125° + 45° = 170°, not 180°. The correct answer is Option C (55°), as 125° + 55° = 180°.

questions.question_text: If one angle is 58°, then its complementary angle is ________ degrees.
questions.explanation_correct: The complementary angle of an angle is the angle that, when added to the given angle, equals 90 degrees. Since the given angle is 58 degrees, the complementary angle is 90 - 58 = 32 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The accepted answer format is a single number. However, the incorrect answer would be 62 degrees, which is not correct. The complementary angle of 58 degrees is 90 - 58 = 32 degrees.

questions.question_text: Two complementary angles are in the ratio 2:3. What is the measure of the smaller angle?
questions.explanation_correct: The two complementary angles are in the ratio 2:3, which means the smaller angle is 2/5 of the total 90 degrees. Therefore, the measure of the smaller angle is 36 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The smaller angle is not 30 degrees because that would make the larger angle 60 degrees, which is not in the 2:3 ratio. The angle is also not 40 or 45 degrees, as those would not fit the 2:3 ratio either. The correct answer is 36 degrees, which is 2/5 of the total 90 degrees for complementary angles.

questions.question_text: Two supplementary angles differ by 40°. The measure of the larger angle is ________ degrees.
questions.explanation_correct: The measure of the larger angle is 110 degrees because two supplementary angles add up to 180 degrees. Since the two angles differ by 40 degrees, the larger angle must be 110 degrees (180 - 40 = 110).
questions.explanation_incorrect: The accepted answer format is a single number, 110 degrees. If the two supplementary angles differ by 40 degrees, the smaller angle would be 70 degrees (180 - 110 = 70), which is incorrect. The correct answer is 110 degrees because the larger angle in a pair of supplementary angles is 110 degrees when they differ by 40 degrees.

questions.question_text: Adjacent angles share a common vertex and a common arm.
questions.explanation_correct: Adjacent angles do share a common vertex and a common arm, which is why the statement is true. The shared vertex and arm are what define adjacent angles.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Adjacent angles do not just share a common side. They must also share a common vertex and a common arm. If the angles only share a common side, but not a common vertex or arm, they would not be considered adjacent angles.

questions.question_text: A linear pair of angles always sums to:
questions.explanation_correct: A linear pair of angles always add up to 180 degrees. This is because when two lines meet at a point, they form two angles that are supplementary, meaning they sum up to 180 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is B) 180°. This is because when two lines meet at a point, they form two angles that are supplementary, meaning they sum up to 180 degrees. Option A) 90° is incorrect because a linear pair of angles does not always add up to 90 degrees. Options C) 270° and D) 360° are also incorrect because they do not represent the sum of a linear pair of angles.

questions.question_text: If two angles form a linear pair and one angle is 72°, the other angle is ________ degrees.
questions.explanation_correct: If two angles form a linear pair, the sum of the two angles is always 180 degrees. Since one angle is 72 degrees, the other angle must be 180 - 72 = 108 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The accepted answer format is a single number, 108. However, the incorrect explanation would be that if two angles form a linear pair and one angle is 72 degrees, the other angle could be any value. This is not correct - the other angle must be 108 degrees, as the sum of the two angles in a linear pair is always 180 degrees.

questions.question_text: Which statement about adjacent angles is NOT always true?
questions.explanation_correct: The statement 'Adjacent angles sum to 180°' is not always true. This is because there are some special types of angles, like complementary angles, where the sum of the angles is not 180°.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Option C is incorrect because the statement 'Adjacent angles sum to 180°' is generally true. Adjacent angles are two angles that share a common side and vertex, and the sum of their measures is always 180°. This is because a straight line is 180°, and adjacent angles form a straight line.

questions.question_text: Two angles form a linear pair. If one angle is 3 times the other, what is the measure of the larger angle?
questions.explanation_correct: If two angles form a linear pair, it means they add up to 180 degrees. Since one angle is 3 times the other, let's say the smaller angle is x. Then the larger angle is 3x. Since they add up to 180 degrees, we can write 3x + x = 180, which simplifies to 4x = 180. Solving for x, we get x = 45 degrees. Therefore, the larger angle is 3 times that, which is 135 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Option C is correct because in a linear pair of angles, the two angles add up to 180 degrees. If one angle is 3 times the other, then the larger angle must be 135 degrees. This is because if the smaller angle is x, then the larger angle is 3x. And 3x + x = 180 degrees, which means x = 45 degrees and the larger angle is 3 times that, which is 135 degrees.

questions.question_text: The sum of all angles formed on one side of a straight line is:
questions.explanation_correct: The sum of all angles formed on one side of a straight line is 180 degrees. This is because a straight line is 180 degrees, and all the angles formed on one side of the line add up to 180 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is B) 180°. When a line is drawn, the angles formed on one side of the line add up to 180 degrees. This is because a straight line is 180 degrees, and all the angles on one side of the line must add up to this value. Options A, C, and D are incorrect because they do not represent the actual sum of the angles formed on one side of a straight line.

questions.question_text: The sum of all angles at a point is ________ degrees.
questions.explanation_correct: The sum of all the angles at a point is 360 degrees because when we draw lines intersecting at a point, the angles formed around that point add up to a complete circle, which is 360 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The sum of all angles at a point is not 180 degrees. That is the sum of the angles in a triangle. The correct answer is 360 degrees, because when lines intersect at a point, the angles formed around that point add up to a complete circle, which is 360 degrees.

questions.question_text: If three angles are formed on a line and two of them measure 50° and 80°, the third angle is 50°.
questions.explanation_correct: If three angles are formed on a line, the sum of the three angles must be 180°. Since two of the angles are 50° and 80°, the third angle must be 180° - 50° - 80° = 50°.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement is incorrect. When three angles are formed on a line, the sum of the three angles must be 180°. If two of the angles are 50° and 80°, the third angle cannot be 50° because that would make the total sum more than 180°. The correct third angle is 50°, as 50° + 80° + 50° = 180°.

questions.question_text: Four angles meet at a point. Three of them measure 85°, 110°, and 75°. What is the fourth angle?
questions.explanation_correct: The sum of all four angles at a point where four lines meet is 360°. Since three of the angles are 85°, 110°, and 75°, the fourth angle must be 90° to make the total sum 360°.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Option A (80°) is incorrect because the sum of all four angles at a point where four lines meet is 360°. The other three angles are 85°, 110°, and 75°, so the fourth angle must be 90° to make the total 360°. Option B (85°) is incorrect because it is one of the given angles. Option D (95°) is incorrect because the sum of all four angles would be more than 360°.

questions.question_text: Three angles on a straight line are in the ratio 2:3:4. The largest angle measures ________ degrees.
questions.explanation_correct: The three angles on a straight line add up to 180 degrees. Since the angles are in the ratio 2:3:4, the largest angle must be 4/9 of 180 degrees, which is 80 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 80 degrees. The question states that the three angles are in the ratio 2:3:4, which means the largest angle is 4 parts out of the total 9 parts. Since the angles add up to 180 degrees, the largest angle must be 4/9 of 180 degrees, which is 80 degrees.

questions.question_text: Five equal angles are formed at a point. What is the measure of each angle?
questions.explanation_correct: Since there are 5 equal angles formed at a point, and the sum of all angles at a point is 360°, each angle must be 360° / 5 = 72°.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect options are not correct because: 60° is not the correct answer since there are 5 equal angles, and the sum of all angles at a point is 360°. 90° is not the correct answer since there are 5 equal angles, and the sum of all angles at a point is 360°. 108° is not the correct answer since there are 5 equal angles, and the sum of all angles at a point is 360°.

questions.question_text: Vertically opposite angles are always equal.
questions.explanation_correct: Vertically opposite angles are always equal because when two lines intersect, the angles formed are supplementary (add up to 180 degrees). The angles on opposite sides of the intersection point are equal.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Vertically opposite angles are not always equal. This is a common misconception. While it is true that vertically opposite angles are supplementary (add up to 180 degrees), they are not necessarily equal. The angles can be of different measures, as long as they add up to 180 degrees.

questions.question_text: Two straight lines intersect at a point. If one angle is 65°, what is the measure of the vertically opposite angle?
questions.explanation_correct: When two straight lines intersect, the angles formed are called vertically opposite angles. Vertically opposite angles are always equal. Since one angle is 65°, the vertically opposite angle must also be 65°.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answers are not correct because when two straight lines intersect, the angles formed are vertically opposite angles. Vertically opposite angles are always equal. So, if one angle is 65°, the other vertically opposite angle must also be 65°, not 25°, 115°, or 125°.

questions.question_text: Two lines intersect forming four angles. If one angle is 130°, then the angle adjacent to it measures ________ degrees.
questions.explanation_correct: When two lines intersect, they form four angles. Since the sum of all four angles is 360°, and one of the angles is 130°, the angle adjacent to it must be 360° - 130° = 50°.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answer would be 130°. However, this is not correct because when two lines intersect, the opposite angles are equal. So, the angle adjacent to 130° must be 360° - 130° = 50°. The accepted answer format is 50.

questions.question_text: Two lines intersect. If the angles formed are (3x + 10)° and (5x - 30)°, and they are vertically opposite, what is the value of x?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is B) 20. When two lines intersect, the opposite (vertically opposite) angles are equal. So, the two angles formed are (3x + 10)° and (5x - 30)°. To find the value of x, we can set these two angles equal to each other: 3x + 10 = 5x - 30, which simplifies to 2x = 40, or x = 20.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answers are not correct because they do not satisfy the given condition. For the angles (3x + 10)° and (5x - 30)° to be vertically opposite, the value of x must be 20, not 15, 25, or 30. This is because when you set the two angles equal to each other, the resulting equation simplifies to 2x = 40, which gives x = 20.

questions.question_text: Two lines intersect such that one angle is expressed as (2x + 15)° and its adjacent angle is (3x - 25)°. Find the measure of the vertically opposite angle to (2x + 15)°.
questions.explanation_correct: The vertically opposite angle to (2x + 15)° is equal to (3x - 25)°. This is because when two lines intersect, the angles formed are supplementary, meaning they add up to 180°. So (2x + 15)° + (3x - 25)° = 180°, which gives x = 20°. Therefore, the vertically opposite angle to (2x + 15)° is (3x - 25)° = 91°.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answers do not correctly calculate the vertically opposite angle. Option A (53°) and B (63°) are wrong because they do not use the fact that the two angles formed are supplementary. Option C (73°) is also incorrect as it does not consider the relationship between the two given angles.

questions.question_text: Perpendicular lines intersect at an angle of 90°.
questions.explanation_correct: Perpendicular lines intersect at an angle of 90° because they form a perfect right angle. This means the angle between the two lines is exactly 90 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Perpendicular lines do not intersect at an angle of 60° or any other angle. They always intersect at 90°, which is a right angle. This is because perpendicular lines are lines that meet at a 90-degree angle, forming a perfect square or rectangle.

questions.question_text: When a transversal cuts two parallel lines, corresponding angles are ________.
questions.explanation_correct: When a transversal (a line that crosses two or more other lines) cuts two parallel lines, the corresponding angles formed are equal. This is because parallel lines maintain the same distance between them, so the angles on the same side of the transversal line are congruent.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'equal'. When a transversal cuts two parallel lines, the corresponding angles (the angles on the same side of the transversal) are equal in measure. This is not the case if the lines are not parallel - the angles formed would be different in size.

questions.question_text: A transversal cuts two parallel lines. If one of the corresponding angles is 75°, what is the other corresponding angle?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is B) 75°. When a transversal cuts two parallel lines, the corresponding angles are equal. Since one of the corresponding angles is 75°, the other corresponding angle must also be 75°.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect options are not correct. When a transversal cuts two parallel lines, the corresponding angles are equal. Since one of the corresponding angles is 75°, the other corresponding angle must also be 75°, not 15°, 105°, or 285°.

questions.question_text: A transversal intersects two parallel lines. If one interior angle on the same side of the transversal is 110°, what is the other interior angle on the same side?
questions.explanation_correct: When a transversal intersects two parallel lines, the interior angles on the same side of the transversal add up to 180°. Since one of the interior angles is 110°, the other interior angle on the same side must be 70° to make the total 180°.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect options do not add up to 180° with the given 110° angle. Option A (60°) and Option C (80°) do not add up to 180°, and Option D (110°) is the same as the given angle, which cannot be the correct answer.

questions.question_text: A transversal cuts two parallel lines forming an alternate interior angle of 65°. The other alternate interior angle is ________ degrees.
questions.explanation_correct: When a transversal cuts two parallel lines, the alternate interior angles are congruent (equal). Since one alternate interior angle is 65°, the other alternate interior angle must also be 65°.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The accepted answer format is a single number, 65. The incorrect answer may be thinking that the other alternate interior angle is different from the first one. However, since the lines are parallel, the alternate interior angles are equal. Therefore, the other alternate interior angle is also 65°.

questions.question_text: Two parallel lines are cut by a transversal. If one angle is (4x + 20)° and its corresponding angle is (6x - 10)°, find x.
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is B) 15. This is because when two parallel lines are cut by a transversal, the corresponding angles are equal. Therefore, we can set up an equation: (4x + 20) = (6x - 10), and solve for x to get x = 15.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answers are not correct because they do not satisfy the given condition. For example, if x = 10, then the two angles would be (4 × 10 + 20) = 60° and (6 × 10 - 10) = 50°, which are not corresponding angles. The correct value of x is 15, as this makes the two angles corresponding angles.

questions.question_text: An angle is 30° more than its complement. The angle measures ________ degrees.
questions.explanation_correct: The angle is 30° more than its complement. The complement of an angle is 90° minus the angle. So, if the angle is 30° more than its complement, then the angle must be 60°.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The accepted answer format is a single number, 60. However, the incorrect answer would be to think that the angle is 30°. This is because the complement of 30° is 60°, and the angle is 30° more than its complement. Therefore, the correct angle measure is 60°.

questions.question_text: Arrange the following angles in ascending order: Reflex angle, Acute angle, Straight angle, Obtuse angle, Right angle
questions.explanation_correct: The angles are arranged in ascending order, from the smallest to the largest. An acute angle is less than 90 degrees, a right angle is exactly 90 degrees, an obtuse angle is more than 90 degrees but less than 180 degrees, a straight angle is exactly 180 degrees, and a reflex angle is more than 180 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The order is incorrect because a reflex angle is larger than a straight angle. A reflex angle is an angle greater than 180 degrees, while a straight angle is exactly 180 degrees. The correct order from smallest to largest is: Acute angle, Right angle, Obtuse angle, Straight angle, Reflex angle.

questions.question_text: Two adjacent angles are in the ratio 5:7. If they form a linear pair, the smaller angle measures ________ degrees.
questions.explanation_correct: If two adjacent angles are in the ratio 5:7, and they form a linear pair, the sum of their measures must be 180 degrees. Since the ratio is 5:7, the smaller angle is 5/12 of 180 degrees, which equals 75 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answer would be 60 degrees. This is because if the ratio of the two angles is 5:7, then the smaller angle would be 5/12 of 180 degrees, which is 75 degrees, not 60 degrees. The key is to understand that the sum of two adjacent angles in a linear pair must be 180 degrees.

questions.question_text: Six angles meet at a point. Five of them are equal and each measures 60°. What is the sixth angle?
questions.explanation_correct: Since the sum of all angles meeting at a point is 360°, and five of the angles are equal at 60° each, the sixth angle must be 60° to make the total 360°.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The sixth angle cannot be 30° because that would make the sum of all angles less than 360°. It cannot be 45° either, as that would make the sum of all angles more than 360°. The correct answer is 60°, as this completes the 360° total when added to the five 60° angles.

questions.question_text: When two straight lines intersect, they form ________ pairs of vertically opposite angles.
questions.explanation_correct: When two straight lines intersect, they form four angles. These four angles are divided into two pairs of vertically opposite angles. Each pair of vertically opposite angles has the same measure, so there are 2 pairs of vertically opposite angles.
questions.explanation_incorrect: When two straight lines intersect, they do not form just one pair of vertically opposite angles. The correct answer is 2 pairs of vertically opposite angles. This is because the four angles formed at the intersection point are divided into two pairs of vertically opposite angles, where each pair has the same measure.

questions.question_text: When a transversal cuts two parallel lines, alternate exterior angles are equal.
questions.explanation_correct: When a transversal (a line that crosses two or more other lines) cuts two parallel lines, the alternate exterior angles formed are equal. This is because parallel lines have the same angles when a transversal cuts them.
questions.explanation_incorrect: If the transversal does not cut two parallel lines, then the alternate exterior angles may not be equal. The alternate exterior angles are only equal when the two lines cut by the transversal are parallel. If the lines are not parallel, the angles formed may be different.

questions.question_text: A transversal cuts two parallel lines. One of the alternate interior angles is (3x + 15)° and the other is (5x - 25)°. Find the measure of these angles.
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is B) 75°. When a transversal cuts two parallel lines, the alternate interior angles are equal. To find the measure of the angles, we can set up an equation using the given information: (3x + 15)° = (5x - 25)°. Solving this equation gives us x = 20°, which means the alternate interior angles are both 75°.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answers are not correct because they do not match the measure of the alternate interior angles when a transversal cuts two parallel lines. The correct answer is 75° because the equation (3x + 15)° = (5x - 25)° gives us x = 20°, and the alternate interior angles are both 75°.

questions.question_text: Four angles at a point measure 120°, 60°, 90°, and 90°. Arrange them in descending order.
questions.explanation_correct: The angles are arranged in descending order because 120° is the largest angle, followed by 90° (which appears twice), and then 60°, the smallest angle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The angles are not arranged in descending order. To arrange them in descending order, we need to put the largest angle first, which is 120°. Then, the two 90° angles come next, followed by the 60° angle. The correct order is: 120°, 90°, 90°, 60°.

questions.question_text: An angle of 360° is called a:
questions.explanation_correct: An angle of 360° is called a complete angle because it covers the entire circle, from the starting point back to the same point.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is C) Complete angle. An angle of 360° is not a straight angle (A), which is 180°. It is also not a reflex angle (B), which is an angle greater than 180°. And it is not a right angle (D), which is 90°. A 360° angle covers the entire circle, so it is called a complete angle.

questions.question_text: Two supplementary angles are in the ratio 7:11. What is the difference between them?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is C) 40°. If two angles are supplementary, they add up to 180°. Since the two angles are in the ratio of 7:11, the smaller angle is 7/18 of 180°, which is 70°, and the larger angle is 11/18 of 180°, which is 110°. The difference between them is 110° - 70° = 40°.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answer is B) 35°. Supplementary angles are two angles that add up to 180°. The ratio of the two angles given is 7:11, which means the smaller angle is 7/18 of 180° (70°), and the larger angle is 11/18 of 180° (110°). The difference between them is 110° - 70° = 40°, not 35°.

questions.question_text: Two lines intersect. The sum of two adjacent angles is 180° and one is twice the other. The smaller angle is ________ degrees.
questions.explanation_correct: Since the sum of the two adjacent angles is 180° and one angle is twice the other, the smaller angle must be 60°. This is because if one angle is twice the other, then the smaller angle must be 1/3 of 180°, which is 60°.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answer would be 45°. This is because the student may think that since the sum of the two angles is 180°, each angle must be 90°, and since one angle is twice the other, the smaller angle must be 45°. However, this is not correct, as the smaller angle is actually 60°.

questions.question_text: Two parallel lines are cut by a transversal. If one co-interior angle is 3 times the other, the smaller angle measures ________ degrees.
questions.explanation_correct: If one co-interior angle is 3 times the other, and the sum of the co-interior angles is 180 degrees, then the smaller angle must be 45 degrees. This is because 3 times the smaller angle plus the smaller angle must add up to 180 degrees, which means the smaller angle is 45 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The accepted answer format is 45 degrees. However, the incorrect answer might be 60 degrees. This is because the co-interior angles formed by two parallel lines cut by a transversal are supplementary, meaning they add up to 180 degrees. If one angle is 3 times the other, then the smaller angle would be 45 degrees and the larger angle would be 135 degrees, not 60 degrees.

questions.question_text: If two adjacent angles are complementary, they cannot form a linear pair.
questions.explanation_correct: If two adjacent angles are complementary, it means they add up to 90 degrees. In this case, they can form a linear pair, which is a pair of angles that add up to 180 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement is incorrect because if two adjacent angles are complementary, they can form a linear pair. A linear pair is a pair of angles that add up to 180 degrees. Since complementary angles add up to 90 degrees, they can be part of a linear pair that adds up to 180 degrees.

questions.question_text: What unit is used for 72°?
questions.explanation_correct: The unit used for 72° is an acute angle. An acute angle is an angle that is less than 90 degrees, and 72° fits this description.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The unit used for 72° is an acute angle, not an obtuse angle, a right angle, or a reflex angle. An acute angle is an angle that is less than 90 degrees, and 72° is less than 90 degrees, so it is an acute angle.

questions.question_text: What unit is used for 90°?
questions.explanation_correct: The unit used for a 90° angle is a 'right angle'. A right angle is an angle that measures exactly 90 degrees, and this is the correct answer from the options given.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A 'right angle' is the unit used for a 90-degree angle. This is because a right angle is a special type of angle that measures exactly 90 degrees. The other options, such as 'acute angle', 'reflex angle', and 'obtuse angle', are different types of angles that do not measure 90 degrees.

questions.question_text: What unit is used for 145°?
questions.explanation_correct: The unit used for 145° is an obtuse angle. An obtuse angle is an angle that is greater than 90 degrees but less than 180 degrees, and 145° falls within this range.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 145° is not a right angle, which is 90 degrees. It is also not an acute angle, which is less than 90 degrees. The correct option is an obtuse angle, which is greater than 90 degrees but less than 180 degrees. 145° is an obtuse angle because it is greater than 90 degrees.

questions.question_text: What unit is used for 270°?
questions.explanation_correct: The unit used for 270° is a reflex angle, which is an angle greater than 180°. A reflex angle is the angle formed when a line is extended beyond a straight line.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are not correct because: Acute angles are less than 90°, obtuse angles are between 90° and 180°, and right angles are exactly 90°. None of these options match the given angle of 270°, which is a reflex angle.

questions.question_text: What is the complement or supplement: of Complement of 40°?
questions.explanation_correct: The complement of 40° is 50°. The supplement of the complement of 40° is therefore 180° - 50° = 130°, which is option B.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The complement of 40° is 50°. The supplement of 50° is 180° - 50° = 130°, not 85°, 60°, or 65°. Option B is the correct answer.

questions.question_text: What is the complement or supplement: of Supplement of 120°?
questions.explanation_correct: The supplement of 120° is 60°, because the sum of two angles that are supplements of each other is always 180°. So, the complement of 60° is also 60°.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The complement of 120° is 60°, not 50°. This is because the complement of an angle is the angle that, when added to the original angle, gives 90°. Since 120° + 60° = 180°, the complement of 120° is 60°, not 50°.

questions.question_text: What is the complement or supplement: of Complement of 25°?
questions.explanation_correct: The complement of 25° is 65°, because the sum of an angle and its complement is always 90°. Therefore, the complement of the complement of 25°, which is 65°, is 25°.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The supplement of an angle is the angle that adds up to 180°. The complement of 25° is 65°, and the supplement of 65° is 115°, not 85°. The correct answer is 65°, which is the complement of the complement of 25°.

questions.question_text: What is the complement or supplement: of Supplement of 95°?
questions.explanation_correct: The supplement of 95° is 85°. This is because the sum of two angles that are supplements of each other is always 180°. So the complement or supplement of the supplement of 95° is also 85°.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The complement of the supplement of 95° is not 65°, 50°, or 60°. The correct answer is 85°. This is because the supplement of 95° is 180° - 95° = 85°. The complement of 85° is also 85°, since the sum of an angle and its complement is always 90°.
